intro: Hieracium schinocephalum, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and basal leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its bright yellow flowers appear in clusters, and it often grows in rocky or gravelly soils. It is a perennial herb that thrives in sunny, well-drained environments.
